itemDescription: English rugby union footballer and cricketer (1856-1933)

wikipedia_page.main: Dr. Lennard Stokes was a rugby union international who represented England from 1875 to 1881. He also captained his country on five occasions, notably in the first ever match against Wales. Like his brother Frederick Stokes, after captaining his country he went on to become the president of the Rugby Football Union.

response: * Lennard Stokes (1856–1933), former captain of the England national rugby union team.

link_mentions.page: Guy's, Kings and St Thomas' Rugby Football Club
